summary: Namelessshipping Discord Server
title: Namelessshipping Discord Server
body:
Doing another round of publicity for the still sort of new but very welcoming Nameless server!

If you like the ship and wish to have more people to share fanarts, songs, HCs, fics or any content whatsoever with, it’s the perfect place to do so! We’re just a bunch of chill nerds with no overly strict rules, only the basics so everyone can have fun.

Don’t hesitate to DM me to join or for more info!

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Emolga
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Emolga
body:
587: Emolga

I think this is yet another of those Pokemon I can jot down as “weird guilty pleasure.” Given everything leading up to now, you’d probably figure I’m just as ambivalent to Emolga as I am Plusle or Pachirisu. But no, I actually do like Emolga quite a bit.

The reason why is weird to admit because I doubt that it was even a conscious design intention for this rodent. But given how much of a big deal superheroes are in modern American culture, it only makes sense that the American region’s very own “mascot” gets to also be a superhero Pokemon, right? I’m still holding out for a traditional superhero Pokemon. We have a handful of Pokemon that are nearly there, Emolga included, but nothing quite hitting the mark. But just glancing at Emolga, yeah, it’s little more than a flying squirrel. Partly becoming responsible for the new tradition of giving these Pikachu-alikes a secondary typing to help differentiate them slightly.

Again though, a major crime of Emolga is that the dang thing doesn’t have a Raichu to go with it. This would’ve been the perfect opportunity to do it too, given this is the generation with a ton of Gen 1 parallels! AND… to go with the superhero thing, Emolga could’ve played sidekick to its own Raichu stage. So as much as I like Emolga, it’s hard to argue its creation is nothing more than a cynical attempt to strike gold once again on Pikachu’s success, with it once again only working out to a lukewarm response from fans.

Personal Score: 8.5/10

A flawed gem in my eyes. And very easily could’ve gotten a higher score if Gamefreak did more to prove to me the superhero look was more than just a happy accident.

[Archive]

reblog.comment:
[[MORE]]

summary: When playing video games, only Rocky plays fair.

For obvious reasons they’ve never even considered D&D.

blog.description:
Tumblr for TheTallGrass - a polymer clay and crochet artist.

My Store is: on Etsy
View All My Work: DeviantArt
Daily Posts On: Instagram
Info Updates On: Facebook
"Price Guide": Here

I take new plushie orders around the end/start of each Month - 12 orders per listing period. Please, please read up on how that works Using this post

All the amigurumi I make and share here (unless VERY rarely specified) are my own patterns. I do not share/sell any patterns at this point in time.

I'm always open to discussing commissions for clay models, too! Not just Amigurumi!

tags: fantastic beasts and where to find them
summary: I’ve decided to do the weekly updates on Monday, now, to actually encompass the whole previous week, as sometimes it would cut...
caption:
I’ve decided to do the weekly updates on Monday, now, to actually encompass the whole previous week, as sometimes it would cut off too early on Sunday when I would still be working on something. So, let’s have Weekly Update #109!

Last week 3 more amigurumi friends were made, starting off with some Pokemon we hadn’t seen in a long time - Litten from the Alola region, and the Pokemon everyone knows, Pikachu! The rest of the crochet week was taken over by an XL sized amigurumi of Evfra from Mass Effect Andromeda!

Over on clay side, a little Niffler necklace pendant was born along with my first ever female Troll character model from World of Warcraft! I’m still open to taking new character model orders, but after another week or so. Feel welcome to discuss them with me before then, though!

Reminder that next Friday, July 27th at 7pm EST I’ll be taking a new batch of amigurumi orders! As previously mentioned, there will be NO custom slots this time around, all 10 slots will be for made to order amigurumi only. You can find a full list of over 90 amigurumi options (a long with prices) here: https://www.deviantart.com/tallgrassart/journal/Complete-List-of-all-Made-To-Order-Amigurumi-740606891

That’s all for now, and if you have any questions or want to see more of my work, be sure to head over to TheTallGrass.etsy.com!

More useful links:
Follow me on DeviantArt: http://TallGrassArt.deviantart.com/
Daily updates on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thetallgrass/
Support new Amigurumi: https://ko-fi.com/TheTallGrass

You can find a full list of over 90 amigurumi options (a long with prices) here: https://www.deviantart.com/tallgrassart/journal/Complete-List-of-all-Made-To-Order-Amigurumi-740606891

That’s all for now, and if you have any questions or want to see more of my work, be sure to head over to TheTallGrass.etsy.com!

trail.content:
I’ve decided to do the weekly updates on Monday, now, to actually encompass the whole previous week, as sometimes it would cut off too early on Sunday when I would still be working on something. So, let’s have Weekly Update #109!

Last week 3 more amigurumi friends were made, starting off with some Pokemon we hadn’t seen in a long time - Litten from the Alola region, and the Pokemon everyone knows, Pikachu! The rest of the crochet week was taken over by an XL sized amigurumi of Evfra from Mass Effect Andromeda!

Over on clay side, a little Niffler necklace pendant was born along with my first ever female Troll character model from World of Warcraft! I’m still open to taking new character model orders, but after another week or so. Feel welcome to discuss them with me before then, though!

Reminder that next Friday, July 27th at 7pm EST I’ll be taking a new batch of amigurumi orders! As previously mentioned, there will be NO custom slots this time around, all 10 slots will be for made to order amigurumi only. You can find a full list of over 90 amigurumi options (a long with prices) here: https://www.deviantart.com/tallgrassart/journal/Complete-List-of-all-Made-To-Order-Amigurumi-740606891

That’s all for now, and if you have any questions or want to see more of my work, be sure to head over to TheTallGrass.etsy.com!
